weather_report:
This afternoon in Downtown San Francisco, the sky is mostly sunny, providing a pleasant respite as the day unfolds. Though the high of around 62 degrees might suggest an inviting warmth, one would do well to prepare for a gradual dip in temperatures, settling around 60 as the afternoon progresses. The brisk west wind, gusting up to 24 mph, adds a touch of invigorating chill, reminding us that layers are our allies in this coastal city. Expecting a shift, the evening will bring a blanket of clouds, with temperatures dipping to a comfortable 53 degrees, creating an atmosphere ripe for introspection or quiet conversation.

As you navigate the afternoon, a light jacket or sweater paired with breathable layers could serve you well, offering comfort amid the dancing breezes. The enticing opportunity to explore the local coffee shops or cozy bookstores beckons, perfect for unwinding as the sun retreats and the city begins to shimmer under the soft glow of streetlights. Although the fog may not roll in quite yet, there is a gentle haze on the horizon that suggests its arrival might not be too far off, making these fleeting moments of clarity all the more special.
